III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
Title qualifications
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation An unknown staff member, a male janitor who was sometimes
referred to as "Captain Hook", sexually abused an unknown child
placed at the program.
Investigation The Complainant for these allegations was anonymous and no
additional information was gathered.
The Chief Administrator was interviewed on 05/20/2024. He
confirmed the name of Staff 1 as the only male janitorial staff and
reported they would have him placed on leave pending the
investigation as a safety plan.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 05/22/2024 with DHHS Worker 1
during an announced, face-to-face visit to the facility. He stated
he has worked as a janitor for the facility for about four months.
His normal shift is 4:00pm-12:30am. Staff 1 described his normal
work duties as not involving any direct contact with the youth in
the program. He stated he is not allowed on the units when youth
are present, and the youth clean their own unit and bedroom
spaces so he is not often on them without youth present. Staff 1
stated there had been a recent arrangement where he worked
with Youth A as community service hours were assigned to this
youth through the facility’s programming. Staff 1 described his
contact with Youth A as having him help out with janitorial duties
for an hour or two each evening, and there was always another
staff member present to help supervise Youth A. Staff 1 denied
there ever being anything inappropriate that occurred between he
and Youth A, or any other youth in the program. He stated they
never were alone, never had physical or sexual contact and there
had not been any inappropriate conversation between the two or
any other youth in the program. Staff 1 stated he had never heard
2

the nickname “Captain Hook” come up from staff or youth in the
program and denied that anyone had called him that.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 05/22/2024 with DHHS Worker
1 during an announced, face-to-face visit to the facility. She
confirmed she helped set up the arrangement between Youth A
and Staff 1 for Youth A to complete community service hours.
Supervisor 1 stated this arrangement involved another staff
member who was fully trained in the facility’s behavior
management policies to be present and provide line of sight for
Youth A. Supervisor 1 stated she had never heard of any
concerns for Staff 1 and did not believe Staff 1 perpetrated any
inappropriate behavior towards the youth in the program.
Youth A was interviewed on 05/22/2024 with DHHS Worker 1
during an announced, face-to-face visit to the facility. He stated
nothing inappropriate between he and Staff 1 had occurred during
his time placed there. Youth A confirmed the community service
hours arrangement where he worked with Staff 1 but stated he
had never been alone with him and Staff 1 had never touched him
or said anything inappropriate towards him. Youth A did not
recognize the nickname “Captain Hook” referring to Staff 1 or
anyone else within the facility.
Staff 2, Staff 3 and Staff 4 were all interviewed separately during
an unannounced, face-to-face visit at the facility on 06/11/2024.
None of the staff had any concern over Staff 1, and none of them
had ever witnessed or heard of any inappropriate behavior
regarding Staff 1. They also all stated they had never heard the
nickname “Captain Hook” referencing any staff within the facility.
Youth B was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
06/14/2024. He reported no concerns over Staff 1 or any other
staff within the program. Youth B stated he had never had
anything inappropriate occur with him from staff, and he denied
ever hearing that inappropriate touch or comments were made to
other youth from staff within the facility.
A video conference was held with DHHS Worker 1 on
06/17/2024. She stated that she could not yet provide a result of
her investigation. The Probation Officer for Youth A was present
and reported she had never received any report from Youth A or
any other youth placed in the program that there were any staff
perpetrating inappropriate touching or comments to youth placed.
3

Documents reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file contained no records of discipline or
any other items of concern.
• Email documentation was received from the Chief
Administrator on 05/20/2024 confirming the suspension of
Staff 1 pending investigation.
• A job description for janitorial staff within the facility was
provided and reviewed. This stated that “the janitor is not
responsible for cleanliness of the dorms and should refrain
from entering student rooms. If dormitory access is
necessary for routine maintenance cleaning of common
areas, it should occur when students are not present.”
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews. There was no evidence found that Staff 1 or any other
staff have perpetrated inappropriate sexual contact or comments
towards youth in the program.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
